Grant.Action: Steps out of the plane confidently and helps Jan Benes out of the plane, showing awareness and readiness.
Allows the man to wipe off the lipstick smudge on his cheek without protest, showing trust and tolerance.
Questions the man politely about the situation despite being kept in the dark, showing patience and good-natured behavior.
Does not resist or complain when left alone in the car in a mysterious situation, showing calmness but also passivity.
Gets hurriedly awakened and dressed, appears confused but cooperative, allows the man to clean the lipstick smudge without protest.
Questions the situation calmly despite lack of information, does not panic or resist.
Follows instructions to stay inside the car and wait without objection, despite being left alone and mystified.
Responds appropriately to the elevator coming to a halt and follows instructions to get out of the car and get on the scooter.
Looks out mystified into the darkness when left alone in the car.
Eyes the female officers appreciatively, showing distraction or lack of focus on the task.
Greets General Carter warmly and engages in concerned conversation about Benes's condition.
Recognizes General Carter and recalls previous encounter at the Pentagon, showing awareness and memory.
Asks pertinent questions about Benes' condition and the situation, demonstrating situational awareness and concern.
Follows General Carter without hesitation, indicating readiness to engage and confidence in the unfolding situation.
Expresses self-doubt and humility about his abilities ('I can't even put a Band-Aid on my finger', 'What can I do? Except maybe pass out?')
Shows polite curiosity about others ('Who's the girl?')
Responds with a somewhat resigned or uncertain tone ('Wish I knew why...')
Expresses self-doubt about his medical skills, saying 'I can't even put a Band-Aid on my finger' and 'What can I do? Except maybe pass out?'
Follows Carter without hesitation despite his uncertainty, showing willingness to engage.
Questions the logic of risking a potentially disloyal doctor, showing concern for safety and trustworthiness.
Expresses uncertainty about Duval's intentions, indicating cautiousness but also a lack of outright suspicion.
Responds respectfully and obediently to orders from superiors.
Questions the rationale behind involving him in security and expresses concern about the risk of surgical assassination, showing awareness of potential threats.
Expresses uncertainty about Duval's intentions, admitting he wouldn't know if Duval is trying to save or kill Benes.
Accepts orders clearly and respectfully from Dr. Michaels, indicating discipline and readiness to follow protocol.
Asks about the technician's well-being, showing concern.
Makes a joking, sarcastic comment about the acronym CMDF.
Expresses amazement and respect for the technology, acknowledging its power.
Asks about the technician's loyalty and questions the meaning of the acronym CMDF, showing curiosity and engagement.
Expresses skepticism about the technology but listens carefully to explanations, indicating open-mindedness and critical thinking.
Makes a cautious comment about the dangers if the technology falls into the wrong hands, showing awareness of risks.
Relies on Carter's explanations without challenging or adding technical insight, showing limited technical knowledge or passivity.
Expresses strong reluctance and fear about being miniaturized and going on the mission, asks Carter to reconsider his choice.
Initially resists the mission, showing self-doubt and vulnerability rather than bravado or selfishness.
Expresses strong reluctance and fear about being miniaturized and going on the mission, tries to refuse the assignment.
Questions the plan and asserts he is not the right man for the mission, showing self-awareness about his own capabilities.
Shakes hands with Michaels, establishing a polite and professional first meeting.
Acknowledges Dr. Duval with a respectful comment ('Oh yes, I've heard of you').
Introduces himself confidently and acknowledges Dr. Duval with a professional remark.
Passively observes the heated argument without intervening or attempting to mediate.
Greets Miss Peterson with a charming tone, attempts friendly small talk with Captain Owens.
Miss Peterson responds with an impersonal nod, no warmth reciprocated or shown by Grant beyond surface charm.
Is described by Carter as uniquely qualified for the mission, a Communications Expert and former Frogman, and someone who brought Benes into the country, implying trust and skill.
Engages in light banter with Captain Owens, showing social ease but no direct demonstration of skill or knowledge in this excerpt.
Engages thoughtfully in technical discussion, expresses concern about the safety of the crew and mission.
Questions the feasibility of traveling at high speed through the circulatory system, showing understanding of physical challenges involved.
Makes a light, somewhat dismissive comment about miniaturization being 'all in a day's work' but follows up with a serious concern.
Asks practical questions about the mission, showing concern for safety and understanding.
Asks how they will know the sub's location at any particular moment, showing engagement and seeking clarity.
Questions about the nature of the attack, indicating awareness and concern for mission risks.
Attempts levity with a joke about getting a cab back to town, but no one responds.
Makes a reflective, rhetorical statement: 'How much can a man give to his country?'
Makes an attempt at levity by asking where to get a cab back to town during a serious discussion, which is ignored by others.
Poses a reflective, patriotic question 'How much can a man give to his country?' as he enters the sterilization section, showing thoughtful engagement.
Starts to help Cora over the threshold, showing consideration.
Grins after Cora tells him not to touch her, indicating a friendly, lighthearted response.
Moves ahead of Cora and attempts to help her over the threshold, showing initiative and attentiveness.
Ignores Cora's warning not to touch her sterile body, indicating a lapse in attention to protocol.
Waves Cora to precede him and is the last to enter the Proteus, showing orderly and confident behavior during boarding.
Carefully climbs the ladder and enters the hatch without hesitation, indicating calm and skillful conduct.
Takes the lead box from Owens without hesitation and engages in technical discussion about the atomic fuel, showing cooperation and respect.
Makes a light, admiring comment about the submarine ('All in all, quite a canoe...'), indicating a friendly and appreciative attitude.
Takes the lead box carefully and listens attentively to Owens' explanation about the atomic fuel and reactor.
Questions the feasibility of the submarine running on a microscopic radioactive particle, showing critical thinking.
Expresses concern about the tight fit and theoretical nature of the power source, indicating awareness of potential risks.
Makes a light, admiring comment about the submarine ('quite a canoe'), showing some appreciation but no direct technical input.
Makes a lighthearted, friendly comment about the love life of an octopus, showing a playful and personable side.
Notices Cora's smile and taps out a message about it, indicating attentiveness and a positive, sincere reaction to others' emotions.
Begins tapping out a message on the wireless promptly after noticing Cora's smile, indicating attentiveness and initiative.
Makes a lighthearted comment about the love life of an octopus, showing social awareness but not directly related to competence.
Engages in light, friendly banter with Cora, making a joke about cooking and laughing gas.
Expresses apprehension about being shrunk, showing vulnerability and openness.
Moves aft confidently and engages in light conversation while observing the lab and equipment.
Jokes about not looking forward to being shrunk, showing some apprehension.
Jokes lightly with Cora about the laser and his near accident, showing a friendly and easygoing manner.
Acknowledges Cora's long service with Dr. Duval with interest, indicating attentiveness and respect.
Makes a serious comment about the laser's potential lethality, showing concern and thoughtfulness.
Recognizes the danger of the laser beam cutting through metal and nearly through his hand, showing awareness of risks.
Engages in light banter with Cora, showing social ease but no direct demonstration of skill or knowledge.
Listens thoughtfully to the wireless message and promptly announces 'Prepare for Miniaturization' loudly for all to hear, demonstrating situational awareness and leadership.
Begins to tap out message promptly when instructed by Owens.
Reacts quite convinced upon first sight of the Miniaturizer, showing confidence and readiness.
Observes the miniaturization process with a moment of wonder and subjective realization of the sub shrinking.
Observes the precision handling machine and the miniaturization process calmly and with scientific interest, exchanging glances with others who seem knowledgeable.
Reacts calmly and observantly to the miniaturization and submersion process, showing awareness of surroundings and situation.
Watches Duval covertly while working at his valve.
Reassures Michaels by telling him he will feel better once underway despite Michaels' obvious distress.
Quickly moves to and opens Valve One as ordered, watches Duval covertly while working, then closes valves promptly when instructed and confirms completion.
Reassures Michaels that he will feel better once underway despite Michaels' visible distress and difficulty breathing.
Helps Michaels with his harness after Michaels struggles with claustrophobia.
Taps out a reply to Proteus call letters promptly, indicating communication is established after full reduction.
Takes down the incoming message accurately and communicates clearly to Owens, preparing the team for injection.
Engages thoughtfully in the scientific discussion, asks clarifying questions about Inner Space.
Makes a casual, somewhat humorous comment calling the bloodstream 'quite a piece of plumbing.'
Responds promptly to the increasing speed and danger along with the others, showing awareness of the situation.
Does not take direct control or initiative in the crisis, instead looks to Michaels for guidance.
Exchanges startled looks with Cora, holds onto stanchions for support during severe vibrations, but does not take any visible action to address the crisis.
Grabs Cora and moves quickly to help her toward her seat, tries to assist her into the harness despite intense buffeting.
Reaches out to Cora to help her during the whirlpool's centrifugal force, showing concern and effort to keep her safe.
Recognizes the danger of the whirlpool and immediately warns the crew to strap in.
Quickly moves to help Cora into her seat despite intense buffeting.
Holds onto a stanchion to maintain stability and attempts to reach Cora during the whirlpool's centrifugal force.
Unable to control the sub or prevent it from being caught in the whirlpool.
Grabs Cora's waist to prevent her from being flung against the bulkhead, holds onto her despite physical strain.
Lets go of the stanchion to reach Cora, slams against the seat base but successfully grabs Cora's waist and holds on despite centrifugal force.
Strains to maintain grip on the seat leg and Cora, effectively preventing her from being flung about during extreme turbulence.
Helps Cora rise after the ordeal, assesses the situation as safe to let go of her.
Exhausted from the ordeal but still attentive to the environment and team safety.
Asks a clarifying question about 'Arterio-Venous Fistula' showing willingness to understand complex medical terms.
Proposes looking for an alternate route when the original path is blocked, demonstrating problem-solving and adaptability.
Expresses frustration about the impossible situation but does not give up hope, saying 'If there's any chance --'
Follows orders to request removal despite emotional stakes
Acknowledges the dire situation realistically by stating 'That's just dandy. We can't go forward -- and we can't go back.'
Hesitates but ultimately follows the order to request removal, showing compliance but no initiative.
No direct actions or statements by Grant in this excerpt; remains absent from decision-making and communication.
Reads the end of the message clearly and confidently to the team, indicating understanding of the critical situation.
Notices the small half-moon shaped opening and points it out promptly to the team.
Throws a look at Duval when Duval expresses doubt, showing confidence and readiness to act despite uncertainty.
Shares amazement with others about the changing color of corpuscles, engaging with the team at the bow windows.
Observes and comments insightfully on the changing color of corpuscles in the capillary, showing attention to detail and understanding of the environment.
Asks Duval to explain the phenomenon, showing curiosity and engagement with others' knowledge.
Shares a moment of awe and connection with Duval and Cora, feeling moved by the shared experience.
Asks Duval to explain the phenomenon they are witnessing, showing curiosity and engagement.
Expresses amazement and uses informal language ('Don't tell me they're refueling...'), indicating an intuitive grasp of the process.
Responds promptly and cooperatively to Owens' urgent call, moves quickly to check the problem, and takes over controls without hesitation.
Responds promptly and moves quickly to check the manual control section when alerted to a problem.
Identifies the specific issue (left tank losing pressure) and communicates it clearly.
Takes over controls from Owens confidently when instructed, indicating readiness and skill.
Suggests a creative solution to the air shortage problem, showing concern for the group's survival.
Suggests using a snorkel to access outside air despite limited reserves, showing creative problem-solving and technical understanding.
Asks relevant questions about the sub's equipment and feasibility of running a tube through the wall, demonstrating situational awareness and initiative.
Calmly addresses a potential safety issue with the laser, involves Cora without blame, and defers testing until after refueling, showing consideration for team priorities and avoiding confrontation.
Questions Cora about the laser's condition in a straightforward manner but without harshness, indicating trust and openness.
Proposes a clear, logical plan to hook up the snorkel to the air chamber to oxygenate the tank, showing understanding of the technical challenge.
Notices the laser swinging loose and immediately calls attention to the safety issue, demonstrating vigilance and responsibility.
Questions Cora about the laser not being properly secured, showing critical thinking and attention to detail.
Decides to postpone testing the laser until after refueling, indicating good judgment about prioritizing tasks under pressure.
Leads the way to put on underwater gear promptly after a problem is noted.
Exchanges looks with Michaels showing dissatisfaction with the explanation but does not escalate or blame.
Leads the way out promptly after deciding to get into the gear quickly, showing decisiveness and initiative.
Exchanges looks with Michaels, both unsatisfied with the explanation about the bolts coming loose, indicating critical thinking and skepticism rather than blind acceptance.
Encourages Michaels to enter the escape hatch despite his fear, saying 'Let's go, Doctor.'
Prioritizes air over answering the wireless, showing practical concern for the group.
Checks Michaels' Breather Pack carefully before proceeding, ensuring equipment is ready.
Decides not to answer the wireless tapping, prioritizing air supply over distractions.
Encourages Michaels to overcome his fear and enter the escape hatch first, showing leadership and confidence.
Opens valve to fill escape hatch with liquid and unlocks ventral hatch efficiently, demonstrating technical skill.
Leads the swim out of the hatch and toward the snorkel, taking initiative and guiding the way.
Signals Owens to proceed and coordinates with him for snorkel release, showing good communication and situational awareness.
Takes initiative to push the snorkel through the alveolar entrance despite danger, suggests a plan to hold it from the other side.
Ignores warnings from Cora and Michaels about the danger involved.
Takes initiative to push the snorkel through the vertical liquid entrance despite the danger.
Understands the danger of air pressure and tries to coordinate with others to hold the snorkel from both sides.
Ignores warnings from Cora and Michaels about the danger, insisting on proceeding anyway.
Takes responsibility for securing his safety line and signals readiness to team, pushing through the alveolus entrance despite danger.
Strains against enormous wind pressure while others support him, showing cooperation and trustworthiness.
Takes out his safety line, hooks it onto his suit, and coordinates with Duval to secure it to the sub, showing careful preparation and awareness of safety.
Acknowledges Duval's signal and pushes the snorkel through the alveolar wall at the precise moment, demonstrating timing and situational awareness.
Props his feet against both sides of the entrance and holds the snorkel firmly despite the rising gale force wind pressure, showing physical strength and determination under extreme conditions.
Holds on with all his strength to the snorkel during a gale force wind, showing determination and endurance.
Tries to get out despite the hurricane, showing persistence and courage.
Climbs back hand over hand using the rope after falling, demonstrating resilience and self-reliance.
Holds on with all his strength to the end of the snorkel during a gale force wind, showing physical endurance and determination.
Lets go of the snorkel immediately when the air tank control button is pressed, indicating responsiveness to commands.
Loses balance and falls, slammed against outcroppings by the force of the wind.
Starts climbing back hand over hand using the rope as one would in scaling a mountain, showing resourcefulness and skill under pressure.
Caught in the tremendous suction of the exhalation and pulled toward the interior of the Lung, losing control of the situation.
Fights the gale, secures safety line around a big rock to avoid being blown away.
Waits out the tornado before moving quickly through the crevice, timing his movement with the breathing cycle.
Encourages Cora to carry spare parts and looks for solutions despite setbacks.
Squeezes into the compartment to pick up the broken transistor and actively engages with the problem.
Offers hope by suggesting he has a source for needed parts, showing support and initiative.
Suggests carrying spare parts, quickly assesses the problem, asks about alternative procedures, and proposes a potential solution by offering a source for needed parts.
Chooses to dismantle the wireless to save Benes' life despite the risk of cutting off communications.
Identifies a critical component to fix the laser by cannibalizing the wireless, showing technical knowledge and decisiveness.
Confidently argues the necessity of sacrificing communications to save Benes' life, demonstrating clear prioritization and confidence.
Exchanges looks with Michaels, then turns away.
Leads the way to the bow and shares a hopeful, poetic observation about the sea at dawn.
Expresses concern about sabotage and the mission's safety.
Leads the way confidently to the bow and assesses the situation with calm observations about the environment.
Exchanges looks with Michaels but then turns away without further engagement or input during a technical procedure.
Accuses Duval of sabotage based on suspicion without clear evidence, lowering trust.
Shares concerns quietly with Michaels, showing discretion and consideration for others present.
Identifies that sabotage has occurred by noticing the tampered safety line and laser fastenings, showing awareness and suspicion of foul play.
Expresses doubt about Michaels' trust in Duval, showing critical thinking and caution.
Keeps track of time remaining on the Minute Recorder and anticipates further sabotage attempts, demonstrating situational awareness and preparedness.
Reacts with amazement at the lymphatic duct walls, showing curiosity and engagement with the environment.
Expresses puzzlement about the lymphatic system, showing curiosity and openness to learning.
Notices the broken fibers drifting against the bow windows and looks back to the stern, indicating awareness and concern for the environment.
Expresses confusion about the existence of multiple bodily systems, indicating a lack of prior knowledge.
Observes the broken fibers drifting against the bow windows and tracks their movement, showing attentiveness and situational awareness.
Expresses concern about seaweed clogging the propulsion, alerting the skipper.
Realizes the danger of repairing the laser now and looks to Michaels for guidance.
Notices the seaweed-like obstruction and alerts Skipper, showing situational awareness.
Realizes the danger of trying to repair the laser at a bad moment and looks to Michaels for input, showing good judgment and caution.
Comments insightfully on the battle, noting the perfect fit of antibodies to bacteria as 'like hand-in-glove,' demonstrating understanding of the biological process.
Questions the route and suggests bypassing the dangerous area, showing concern for the team's safety.
Acknowledges the enemy tracking them and expresses worry about their precautions, indicating awareness and care for the mission and team.
Questions the current route and suggests taking an alternative path to bypass danger.
Asks why they do not take the alternative route after it is mentioned.
Observes and warns that enemies are tracking them and will take precautions.
Asks the Skipper what's wrong, showing concern and attentiveness.
Nods and prepares to go out despite danger, showing responsibility and willingness to help.
Steps into the Escape Hatch without hesitation, indicating trust and commitment to the team.
Makes a lighthearted comment about needing a lawnmower while addressing the clogged vents, showing a friendly and approachable demeanor.
Recognizes the problem with the clogged intake vents and immediately decides to address it by preparing to go outside to clear the obstruction.
Confidently puts on his Breather Pack and enters the Escape Hatch despite the presence of dangerous Antibodies nearby.
Makes a lighthearted comment ('I could use a lawnmower...') while assessing the clogged vents, showing situational awareness and calmness under pressure.
Acknowledges that clearing the vents will take 'quite a while,' demonstrating realistic assessment of the task duration.
Pulling seaweed-like fibers out of the intake vents quickly and persistently despite the task seeming endless.
Flung in one direction by sudden vibrations caused by a dropped surgical scissors.
Hears Cora's distress call and immediately looks for her, then points out her location to Michaels to help rescue her.
Hears Cora's faint call for help, quickly looks around for her location, and coordinates with Michaels to find and rescue her.
Initially does not see Cora immediately but continues searching and listens carefully to audio cues.
Urgently warns Michaels to get back in the sub to avoid danger.
Races to reach Cora before the antibodies do, showing concern for her safety.
Works desperately to free Cora from the strands, cooperating with her efforts.
Sees the danger approaching Cora and immediately orders Michaels to get back to the sub quickly.
Races to reach Cora before the antibodies do and starts working desperately to free her from the strands.
Helps Cora by freeing her Breather Pack and pulling strands to free her ankles despite the danger and urgency.
Supports and holds exhausted Cora as they swim toward safety, showing care and concern for her wellbeing.
Manages to get Cora's Breather Pack loose and frees her from the strands at her ankles under pressure.
Grabs Cora at the torso and propels her upward through the dangerous environment despite exhaustion.
Holds Cora with one arm as she becomes too exhausted to keep pace, continuing to swim toward safety.
Reaches the ventral hatch and waits with hand at the wheel, showing readiness and control.
Thrusts Cora through the door to protect her from the attacking Antibodies, then follows after her despite the danger.
Struggles with all his strength to close and lock the door against the attacking Antibodies, showing determination to protect both himself and Cora.
Attempts desperately to loosen the coils constricting Cora despite the narrow confines and difficulty.
Turns the wheel quickly to open the hatch as soon as the light flashes green, showing quick reaction under pressure.
Thrusts Cora through the door before following himself, prioritizing her safety and acting decisively.
Struggles with all his strength to close and lock the door against the attacking Antibodies, ultimately succeeding despite difficulty.
Unable to help Cora free herself from the Antibodies due to narrow confines and their tightening grip, showing limits of his capability in this situation.
Drags Cora out of the Escape Hatch and joins in the frantic effort to free her from the crystalline coils.
Continues to pull at the coils restraining Cora despite initial failure, showing persistence and concern.
Drags Cora out of the Escape Hatch and joins in the frantic effort to free her from the crystalline coils, showing persistence and physical capability under pressure.
Despite desperate efforts, fails to loosen any of the coils constricting Cora initially.
Reacts to the complexity of the brain chart and notes the distance remaining, showing situational awareness.
Questions the source of the light coming through the bow windows, indicating curiosity and attention to detail.
Tells Cora there is no need to get up, showing concern for her condition.
Responds to Cora's thanks with a modest, somewhat dismissive 'That's what they pay me for.'
Engages in light, somewhat playful banter with Cora about his role and Duval, smiling.
Does not directly acknowledge or comfort Cora's emotional expression about the outside world.
Calmly reassures Cora and acknowledges his role with confidence ('That's what they pay me for').
Engages in a subtle conversation about surveillance and suspicion, showing awareness and wit.
Does not reveal any insecurity or confusion when confronted with Cora's suspicions, instead responds with humor and composure.
Explains to Cora that personal feelings can affect one's point of view, showing understanding and empathy.
Moves toward the door with Cora upon hearing a heated argument, showing concern and readiness to engage.
Observes the argument quietly and comments that it sounds like trouble, then moves toward the door with Cora to witness the situation.
Joins Cora and Duval at the bow, participates in poetic exchange showing openness and shared appreciation.
Engages thoughtfully in poetic and philosophical dialogue, showing reflective and articulate responses.
Questions the captain about the consequences of overstaying, showing concern for the team's safety.
Disobeys direct orders by turning off key switches to stop the sub, potentially endangering the mission.
Questions the skipper about the consequences of overstaying, showing awareness and concern for mission constraints.
Asks how long it will take to get to the Removal Point, seeking critical timing information.
Moves quickly to the Manual Panel and throws key switches into the OFF position, stopping the sub to prevent danger.
Takes decisive action to get the laser and power unit despite opposition, enabling Duval and Cora to attempt a rescue.
Disregards Michaels' authority and warnings, potentially endangering the group by allowing Duval and Cora to leave the ship.

Takes control of the situation by overriding authority to address an urgent problem, directs others to get the laser and power unit, opens the Escape Hatch to allow Duval and Cora to attempt a rescue.
Ignores Michaels' orders and warnings about the danger and potential failure, risking the mission and lives by allowing Duval and Cora to leave the ship despite opposition.
Expresses doubt about Michaels' accusation and refuses to believe Duval is a fanatic, showing trust and tolerance.
Volunteers to go out and help despite danger, indicating willingness to assist and concern for others.
Puts on his Breather Pack promptly when the Escape Hatch is being flooded.
Questions Michaels' accusation about Duval being a fanatic and relies on his own experience to judge the situation.
Decides to go out and help despite the danger and time constraints, showing initiative and confidence.
Glances at the minute recorder to keep track of time before closing the door, demonstrating awareness and time management.
Drops out and starts toward Duval and Cora without hesitation, showing decisiveness.
Glances at his wrist watch and asks Duval how the operation is progressing, indicating attentiveness and communication.
Glances at his wrist watch and realistically assesses the situation by telling Duval 'Doctor, we've just about had it.'
Glances at his wrist watch, showing awareness of time pressure and concern for the team's safety.
Takes initiative by grabbing the laser and leading the way to intercept the Proteus, showing leadership and willingness to act for the group's benefit.
Glances at his wrist watch to monitor time and recognizes urgency, saying 'We better get back to the sub. Every second counts now.'
Gets an idea quickly when the Proteus is heading toward the Central Nerve and immediately takes initiative by grabbing the laser and leading the way to intercept.
Grabs the laser from Duval and takes the lead in aiming and firing the laser with full power to disable the rudder and create an opening.
Takes careful aim before firing the laser, demonstrating precision and control.
Acknowledges the dire situation and suggests a practical plan to escape on their own.
Assesses the situation realistically by acknowledging the ship is damaged and suggests escaping on their own.
Asks if there is a quick way out, showing practical problem-solving and seeking efficient solutions.
Stops Duval from rushing in recklessly and assesses the threat before acting.
Hands the laser to Duval and instructs him and Cora to hold off the threat, taking the lead himself.
Stops Duval from rushing in, assesses the threat of White Corpuscles before acting.
Hands the laser to Duval and instructs him to hold off the threat, then proceeds himself to investigate and act.
Swims through damaged hull and flooded narrow area quickly and efficiently, picking up Breather Packs on the way.
Hurries to help Owens regain consciousness and equips him with Breather Pack, showing concern and quick response.
Attempts to free Michaels from the steel arm despite growing danger, showing determination and care.
Realizes Michaels is sabotaging the mission but still tries to help him, indicating tolerance and complexity in judgment.
After Michaels is engulfed, Grant quickly moves on with Owens to escape, showing practical focus but no visible emotional reaction to Michaels' fate.
Quickly makes his way through a flooded area, picks up Breather Packs en route, and assesses the situation with Owens and Michaels.
Realizes Michaels is the saboteur and instructs Owens to put on a Breather Pack quickly.
Attempts to free Michaels from the steel arm with all his strength but fails.
Makes a last desperate effort to free Michaels as the Bubble is being engulfed, but is ultimately unsuccessful.
Decides to retreat with Owens through the Lab Section when rescue is impossible.
Follows Owens through a cramped area, showing willingness to proceed despite difficulty.
Is caught and grasped by a White Corpuscle and struggles to break free unsuccessfully.
Swims quickly toward Duval and Cora after being freed, showing prompt reaction.
Complains about the lack of a quick way out, indicating frustration or possible lack of situational control.
No direct actions or statements by Grant in this excerpt to evaluate competence.
Puts one arm around Cora's waist to help her keep up with the group despite her fatigue.
Moves immediately to Benes and greets him warmly, extending his hand and asking kindly about his condition.
Moves immediately to Benes upon entering the hospital room and warmly greets him, showing attentiveness and confidence.
Expresses concern and seeks clarification when Carter explains Benes cannot remember a critical piece of information, demonstrating awareness and engagement.
Says goodbye to Mr. Benes with a sincere and respectful tone, acknowledging the experience of knowing him.
After being knocked down in a scooter accident, immediately helps Owens up and hustles him to the hospital, showing concern and responsibility.
Acknowledges the need to move forward promptly and initiates leaving with Owens.
Paces and looks at Benes thoughtfully before saying goodbye, showing awareness of the situation's gravity.
After a scooter collision, quickly gets up despite holding his head and immediately helps Owens to get to the hospital.
Insists that he and Owens are not hurt and downplays the situation despite others' concern.
Insists that he and Owens are fine despite signs of injury, rushes Owens onto a scooter and speeds away recklessly, nearly causing a crash and driving in the wrong lane.
